Donald Trump Calls PM Modi A 'Great Friend', Says India Visit 'Could Be' Next Year Amid Talks

Trade talks with India have progressed, says Trump





NEW YORK/WASHINGTON: US President Donald Trump has said he may travel to India next year, adding that PM Modi "wants" him to visit."He's a friend of mine, and we speak... He wants me to go there. We will figure that out. I will go. I will have a great trip there with Prime Minister Modi, he's a great man. And I'll be going," Trump said Thursday in response to a question. Asked if the visit could happen next year, Trump said, "It could be, yeah."India is due to host the next Quad summit with leaders from Australia, Japan, and US, after the 2024 meeting in Delaware. However, dates are yet to be announced. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal in New Delhi declined to comment on the visit. "I will let you know when I have (information)," Jaiswal said.On trade, Donald Trump claimed progress in talks with India and repeated his assertion that India had reduced oil imports from Russia. "It's great, going good. He (PM Modi) stopped... Largely, he stopped buying oil from Russia," he said.Trump had imposed 25% reciprocal tariffs on India and an additional 25% levy on purchases of Russian oil, taking total levy to 50%.India had called the measures "unfair, unjustified and unreasonable".Trump also revisited an oft-repeated claim: that he stopped a war between India and Pakistan using tariffs. "Of the eight wars I ended, five or six were ended because of tariffs," he said. "If you take a look at India and Pakistan, they started to fight - they are two nuclear nations... And I said, 'Listen, if you guys are going to fight, I'm gonna put tariffs on you.' Within 24 hours, I settled the war. If I didn't have tariffs, I wouldn't have been able to settle that war. " Trump called tariffs a "great national defence."On May 10, he announced on social media that India and Pakistan had agreed to a "full and immediate ceasefire" after a "long night" of talks mediated by Washington. He has since repeated that claim more than 60 times.
Article Summary: US President Donald Trump has said he may travel to India next year, adding that PM Modi "wants" him to visit. India is due to host the next Quad summit with leaders from Australia, Japan, and US, after the 2024 meeting in Delaware.

Article Title: Centre retracts order to replace Panjab University's senate, syndicate
Article Text:
Panjab University

NEW DELHI: The Union ministry of education announced on Friday that the order changing the constitution and composition of Panjab University's senate and syndicate stands rescinded.Panjab University's decision to replace 59-year-old senate and syndicate with a smaller, largely nominated structure, triggered sharp political reactions in Punjab, with chief minister Bhagwant Mann calling it "unconstitutional.""It has been decided by the ministry of education that the order changing the constitution and composition of the senate and syndicate shall stand rescinded," the ministry said in a statement.On the basis of recommendation of a high-level committee constituted in March 2021 by the chancellor of the university and consultations with various stakeholders, the Centre had issued a notification to modify the constitution and composition of the senate and syndicate of the university."After the issue of the order, various feedback were received from stakeholders like students, teachers, former VCs and the current VC of the Panjab University. The govt also considered the inputs received in meeting with various student organisations," the ministry added.
Article Summary: Panjab University's decision to replace 59-year-old senate and syndicate triggered sharp political reactions in Punjab. Chief minister Bhagwant Mann called it "unconstitutional" Union ministry of education announced on Friday that the order changing the constitution and composition of Pan Punjab University's senate and Syndicate stands rescinded.

Article Title: A former Red bastion gets its first women's hospital
Article Text:
The hospital will serve as a lifeline for five southern talukas of Gadchiroli where patients earlier had to travel long distances to Chandrapur or Nagpur for advanced maternity care

NAGPUR: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis will inaugurate Saturday a 100-bed women's and child hospital at Aheri in southern Gadchiroli, marking a major milestone in public health infrastructure for the tribal-dominated pocket that was once a Maoist stronghold.The inauguration of Women's Hospital and Newborn Baby Centre, built at a cost of Rs 83 crore, is aimed at strengthening maternal and child healthcare in one of the most remote regions of Maharashtra.The opening comes amid intensified crackdown that led to the surrender of several rebels, including that of Maoist top gun Mallojula Venugopal Rao alias Bhupathi along with several cadres in Gadchiroli.Collector Avishyant Panda said the hospital project represents a coordinated effort between the state govt and district administration. "Civil construction was funded by the state govt, while the district administration financed the equipment and furniture," Panda said.The hospital will serve as a lifeline for five southern talukas of Gadchiroli - Aheri, Etapalli, Bhamragad, Sironcha, and Dhanora - where patients earlier had to travel long distances to Chandrapur or Nagpur for advanced maternity care. "With specialised services like C-sections and neonatal critical care now available locally, we expect a significant reduction in maternal and infant mortality rates," Panda said.Spread across 13,460 sqm, the hospital is expected to handle hundreds of deliveries each month and offer 24-hour emergency obstetric and paediatric services. It will also function as a training and referral centre for local healthcare workers, enabling faster diagnosis and intervention in complicated cases.
Article Summary: The hospital will serve as a lifeline for five southern talukas of Gadchiroli. Patients earlier had to travel long distances to Chandrapur or Nagpur for advanced maternity care. The opening comes amid intensified crackdown that led to the surrender of several rebels.

Article Title: After 8 years on the run, man held for journo's murder
Article Text:
Representative image

MOHALI: After an eight-year-hunt, Mohali police have arrested Gaurav Kumar, wanted for the double murder of senior journalist KJ Singh and his mother, Gurcharan Kaur. Kumar was arrested in Noida Thursday.Kumar frequently changed cities and jobs to avoid detection and had managed to build a new identity for himself, say police. His employers were stunned to learn that he was an absconder in a high-profile murder case.The "model worker" had been promoted from security guard to manager at a construction firm in the last few years and had married. But police stayed on his trail. The chase turned into a sprint in the last 10 days when tips from elders in his village turned the cold trail hot. Kumar was taken completely by surprise when a team from Mohali police's "Proclaimed Offenders Staff" surrounded him. He has been brought to Mohali and will be produced in court.The Singhs were found murdered at their home in Mohali during the intervening night of September 22-23, 2017. The killings sent shockwaves across Punjab.SSP Harmandeep Singh Hans said sustained surveillance and intelligence inputs finally led to the accused."The motive of murder was spontaneous. KJ Singh saw this man sitting near the boundary wall of his house and asked him to go away. The other man got offended and entered his house to kill him and his mother," Hans said.Police identified Kumar as the suspect and registered a case at Mataur police station on September 23, 2017. But Kumar was nowhere to be found. He was declared a proclaimed offender in 2022.DSP Naveen Pal Singh said that when the case was handed to him, he and his team began "connecting evidence" and went to Kumar's native village. With the help of sarpanches and panches, police traced him to Noida, where he was caught. Singh said, "He was traced to a construction site in Noida. He joined the firm as a security guard and was elevated to supervisor before being made manager of the project. According to his employer, his conduct was very good. .. They were shocked to know that he is a double-murder accused."
Article Summary: Gaurav Kumar was wanted for the double murder of senior journalist KJ Singh and his mother, Gurcharan Kaur. Kumar frequently changed cities and jobs to avoid detection and had managed to build a new identity for himself, say police. The chase turned into a sprint in the last 10 days when tips from elders in his village turned the cold trail hot.
